and clean finish on the inside of your hat pattern copyright © wild kitten the pattern is for unlimited personal use do not reproduce or sell the pattern or sell items that are knitted from this the crown crown shaping if you have been working the joggles stripes technique it will no longer be necessary for the remainder of the project rnd1 k11 k2tog repeat to end rnd2 and all even numbered rnds k to end of round rnd3 k10 k2tog repeat to end rnd5 k9 k2tog repeat to end rnd7 k8 k2tog repeat to end rnd9 k7 k2tog repeat to end rnd11 k6 k2tog repeat to end rnd13 k5 k2tog repeat to end rnd15 k4 k2tog repeat to end rnd17 k3 k2tog repeat to end rnd19 k2 k2tog repeat to end rnd21 k1 k2tog repeat to end rnd23 k2tog repeat to end break your yarn leaving a 6 tail with your tapestry needle thread yarn tail through the remaining live stitches and pull tightly to close the top of your hat weave in all ends invisibly on the ws of fabric pattern copyright © wild kitten the pattern is for blocking your hat on a balloon inflate the balloon to slightly less than the head circumference of the wearer to avoid stretching the hat out shape the hat over it while damp and leave to dry slouchy version if you want slouchy version knit body of hat until you work is 20cm/8 from cast on edge then do decrease like this rnd1 k6 k2tog repeat to end rnd3 k5 k2tog repeat to end rnd5 k4 k2tog repeat to end rnd7 k3 k2tog repeat to end rnd9 k2 k2tog repeat to end rnd11 k1 k2tog repeat to end rnd13 k2tog repeat to end rnd15 k2tog repeat to end break your yarn leaving a 6 tail with your tapestry
